KnowledgeBase.Title: isDirectory
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory
Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean

Function.Description: The isDictionary function returns true is the argument is Directory. Otherwise, it returns false.

Brief.Overview: The isDirectory Function returns true if the argument {arg} is a Directory; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isDirectory function is used to query an object to see if it is of type Directory. An alternate method would be to use the isType function using the Type argument as type Directory.

Argument.Name: arg
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex

Syntax.Return: Returns true if arg is a Directory. Returns false if arg is not a Directory.
